definitions.text: rotary motion of an object around its own axis
a list of names
examples: his name was struck off the rolls

definitions.text: a long heavy sea wave as it advances towards the shore
photographic film rolled up inside a container to protect it from light
a round shape formed by a series of concentric circles (as formed by leaves or flower petals)
a roll of currency notes (often taken as the resources of a person or business etc.)
examples: he shot his roll on a bob-tailed nag

definitions.text: small rounded bread either plain or sweet
a deep prolonged sound (as of thunder or large bells)
the sound of a drum (especially a snare drum) beaten rapidly and continuously
a document that can be rolled up (as for storage)
anything rolled up in cylindrical form
the act of throwing dice
walking with a swaying gait
a flight maneuver; aircraft rotates about its longitudinal axis without changing direction or losing altitude
the act of rolling something (as the ball in bowling)
move by turning over or rotating
examples: The child rolled down the hill
turn over on your left side

definitions.text: move along on or as if on wheels or a wheeled vehicle
examples: The President's convoy rolled past the crowds

definitions.text: occur in soft rounded shapes
flatten or spread with a roller
emit, produce, or utter with a deep prolonged reverberating sound
arrange or or coil around
examples: roll your hair around your finger
Twine the thread around the spool
She wrapped her arms around the child

definitions.text: begin operating or running
shape by rolling
execute a roll, in tumbling
sell something to or obtain something from by energetic and especially underhanded activity
move in a wavy pattern or with a rising and falling motion
examples: the waves rolled towards the beach

definitions.text: move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment
examples: The cattle roam across the prairie
the laborers drift from one town to the next
They rolled from town to town

definitions.text: move, rock, or sway from side to side
examples: The ship rolled on the heavy seas

definitions.text: cause to move by turning over or in a circular manner of as if on an axis
examples: They rolled their eyes at his words

definitions.text: pronounce with a roll, of the phoneme /r/
boil vigorously
take the shape of a roll or cylinder
show certain properties when being rolled
